titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Franklin Gorin, Indictment
CWG4233

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
AGAINST
Franklin Gorin

Jefferson Circuit Court,
October Term, A. D. 1863.

The Grand Jurors of the County of Jefferson in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Franklin Gorin of the crime of malicious shooting with the intent to kill committed in manner and form as follows, to=wit: The said Franklin Gorin in the said County of Jefferson on the 11th day of July. A. D. 186. did unlawfully, willfully, wickedly, feloniously and of his malace aforethought, shoot at and wound W C Wood with a gun and with a Pistol, loaded with leaden bullitt and with a hard substance, in and upon histhe body, the body of the said Wood, and in and upon his cheek and face, wounding the said Wood and of which wound the said Wood did not die, with the intent to kill him the said Wood, contrary to the form of the statute in such cases, made and provided against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Witnesses
W C Wood. Thos J Elliott. R J Elliott. F S. J. Ronald. Jas Sayers, Thos Antle, A Gilmore, H C Murrett, R H Cockrell. Collis Ormsby.

A Copy
att J P Chambers clk

Thos E Bramlette
Govr of Ky --

The Commonwealth of Kentucky.
Indictment.
vs } Malicious Shooting
Franklin Gorin
A True Bill.
Joseph T Tompkins
Foreman.
1863 Octo 20th Recd from Grand Jury & filed

A copy
att J P Chambers c
